title: Executive Order 6635-Wichita, Kansas, Abolished as a Customs Port of Entry
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by section 1 of the act of August 1, 1914 (ch. 223, 38 Stat. 609, 623; 19 U.S.C., sec. 2), Wichita, Kansas, is hereby abolished as a customs port of entry in customs collection district no. 45 (St. Louis), with headquarters at St. Louis, Missouri, effective as of 30 days from the date of this order.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6635-Wichita, Kansas, Abolished as a Customs Port of Entry Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362404
